raid.log¶
class raid.AntiRaid(bot)¶

Bases: discord.ext.commands.Cog

The base class that all cogs must inherit from.

A cog is a collection of commands, listeners, and optional state to help group commands together. More information on them can be found on the Cogs page.

When inheriting from this class, the options shown in CogMeta are equally valid here.

await raid(self, ctx)¶

Controls raid mode on the server. Calling this command with no arguments will show the current raid mode information. You must have Manage Server permissions to use this command or its subcommands.

await raid_on(self, ctx, *, channel=None)¶

Enables basic raid mode on the server. When enabled, server verification level is set to table flip levels and allows the bot to broadcast new members joining to a specified channel. If no channel is given, then the bot will broadcast join messages on the channel this command was used in.

Parameters

channel (discord.TextChannel) –

await disable_raid_mode(self, guild_id)¶
await raid_off(self, ctx)¶

Disables raid mode on the server. When disabled, the server verification levels are set back to Low levels and the bot will stop broadcasting join messages.

await raid_strict(self, ctx, *, channel=None)¶

Enables strict raid mode on the server. Strict mode is similar to regular enabled raid mode, with the added benefit of auto-banning members that are spamming. The threshold for spamming depends on a per-content basis and also on a per-user basis of 15 messages per 17 seconds. If this is considered too strict, it is recommended to fall back to regular raid mode.

Parameters

channel (discord.TextChannel) –

await mentionspam(self, ctx, count=None)¶

Enables auto-banning accounts that spam mentions. If a message contains count or more mentions then the bot will automatically attempt to auto-ban the member. The count must be greater than 3. If the count is 0 then this is disabled (also deletes the data from database). This only applies for user mentions. Everyone or Role mentions are not included. To use this command you must have the Ban Members permission.

Parameters

count (Optional[int]) –

await mentionspam_ignore(self, ctx, *channels)¶

Specifies what channels ignore mentionspam auto-bans. If a channel is given then that channel will no longer be protected by auto-banning from mention spammers. To use this command you must have the Ban Members permission.

Parameters

channels (discord.TextChannel) –

await mentionspam_unignore(self, ctx, *channels)¶

Specifies what channels to take off the ignore list. To use this command you must have the Ban Members permission.

Parameters

channels (discord.TextChannel) –
